Posts.Title: Any more word on Cathi
Pure clutter..... my daughter is appearing in a local commercial

Posts.Content:
I am sorry I think I mislead everyone.  Monday was just the "hey here I am doctor and look at this big ugley can't wear a t-shirt thing on my shoulder" visit.  I get to have it removed on November 3rd.  They are going to put me in a "twilight" sleep since I am a big baby and the darn thing is on my shoulder where it would be hard for me to look away while he is cutting into me.  But he says not to worry about
 the lymph nodes or anything else.  Told me it was great to see me after 9 (count them NINE)  years.  He is the same doctor who insisted on me getting a biopsy even though he was sure it was nothing "but just in case". Did my masectomy way back on 12/30/99.  I owe my life to this man.
Posts.Title: Appointment on Monday for removal of a tumor

Posts.Content: I stayed home today.  My shoulder is sore sore sore.  But the whole procedure took 25 minutes.  They sent the tumor to the pathologist office and I will get results when I see the doctor for my follow-up visit.  Not expecting anything bad with that though.
Posts.Title: Surgery went fine on Monday

Posts.Content: I go in tomorrow to have a tumor looked at that is on my shoulder.  No big deal as it is one of those "fatty" (hate that term) tumor.  I have had it for at least 20 years but in the last three months it is annoying the heck out of me.  My only concern is that it is on the same side as my cancer was so hopefully there will be no problem with lymphodema (sp).  So say a little prayer that is turns out to be as little a deal as I am thinking that it is.
Posts.Title: Appointment on Monday for removal of a tumor

Posts.Content: Good luck on Tuesday.  My 9th anniversary is 8 weeks away.  Wow.

. "  I am from Warren.  It is a small town and if that is where he went for a bigger hospital I am thinking he is out in the country, clear the hell out in the country. He must be at St. Joe's or Trumbull.  Both are excellant but of course I would side with the Catholic one.   In fact I am going to be at that hospital on Saturday.

Posts.Content: When my oncologist put me on Arimidex I was still having periods.  She spoke to me about getting the Lupron shots and I asked her if I could  just have my ovaries out instead.  My gynocologist had already spoken to me about doing this earlier in the year.  It was quick and as far as I am concerned easier and cheaper then the shots.  I was in the hospital overnight and released the next day.  I had some problems with hot flashes and realize that I have some heavy winter sweaters that will never be on my body again.  I take effexor to help with the hot flashes and mood swings.  Of course I still state that I do not have mood swings I have "stupid husband swings"  but more on that later.
Posts.Title: Anyone heard of inducing menopause to use aromatase inhibitors?

Posts.Content: I love the Embassy suites.  The breakfast that comes with the room is fantastic and the drinks are pretty good too.  This date is fine with me but seems maybe quick for our out of towners with plane fares and all that.  I will probably just stay with my sister in Amherst for the weekend but will have my Tony and Jordan with me.

Posts.Title: Have you ever had one of those years??

Posts.Content: **** Goddard has to be 100. Okay somewhere in his late 60's or early 70's.  He looked old when I was a little girl watching him.  I saw him last week when I was visiting my parents.  Whatever happened to the blond lady that was on NBC forever then went to Fox.  My brother was teasing me last week.  Asked me who someone was on the TV.  I was like.... duh... Michael Stanley.
Posts.Title: Mia B thanks for roll call info!
No more country music on my way to work anymore......
Mia B thanks for roll call info!

Posts.Content: Oh my gosh... both of us have tried to write this man's FIRST name.  His full name is Richard but he goes by ****.  I was born in 63 and I do remember Phil D and Polka Varities every Sunday at noon.  We drive by the Ravenna arsenal on our way home to Mom and Dad's.  off of route 5.  Funny thing .. we never watched the Youngstown stations even though they were only 15 minutes away.  We always watched Cleveland news.  That was 45 minutes away.

Posts.Content: for me it would be time to get a new doctor.  Jordan had 102 to 103 temp two weeks ago.  Went in and was diagnosed with an ear infection.  Which was not what I was expecting to hear but within two days she was back to herself.

Posts.Content: Here's hoping you are okay.  Don't make me get HowieSteve to come get you.  I spoke to Paula and they are stocked up on batteries for his new device.  For the rest of you, my brother in law has horrible back pains.  He has this device attached to him that to my knowledge sounds like a "tens" unit.  Sends impulses to the nerves.  I had one on my leg for a while.  If all goes well he will have it implanted into his back.

Posts.Title: Interesting item from my Mom

Posts.Content: Well maybe now it will be more important on Capital Hill.  As much as I hate to see anyone be diagnosed with this for some reason a disease is not important until a "famous" person gets it.  I mean c'mon .. do  you think Michael J. Fox gave a hoopla about Parkinson disease twenty five years ago when he was on Family Ties.   I am sorry that she was diagnosed but I am sorry that all of us have to deal with this disease with no cure in sight.  Longer life spans but no cure.

Posts.Title: Jo-Ann just called. She is on her way to hospital.

Posts.Content: I had no nodes but still had chemo.  Was told that it was preventive maintenance.  I took tamoxifin but switched over to Amrimidex with much better results for me.  Glad to see you posting.  Can you believe that Steve and  Paula have been married for 11 years already.
Posts.Title: Seeing oncologist....

Posts.Content: Follow up post... I don't press my religion onto anyone but I thought this was so interesting to look at.    So many talented people in this world
Posts.Title: Interesting item from my Mom
Oh my gosh... did we get our hands slapped or what....LOLOLOL (m)

Posts.Content: this past week my mom-in-law and my sister's sister-in-law were diagnosed with breast cancer.  Can you believe this crap?  My Mom-in-law is severly overweight.  300+ ... so surgery is out of the question since she has heart problems. She has known about this for a couple of months now but we just found out this past week.   She will not do chemo because she watched Tony's father die from leukemia.  So... not looking good.  She is going the Susan Somer's route.   All herbal products.  She is a Cherokee Indian and several medicine men are praying for her.  Hopefully the mass will shrink.
Posts.Title: Never thought that I would be posting this..................(m)
Babyseester... I see you are home posting already!!

Posts.Content: Thank you... and thank you for the post card.  I meant to post about that and ..... no excuse comes to mind so it was bad manners on my part. It made me chuckle and the card made me long for the desert that I consider my home.
Posts.Title: Never thought that I would be posting this..................(m)

Posts.Content:
Annette - born in NE Ohio, now living in SW Ohio but my heart and soul is still out west. Have lived in Burbank, Hollywood Hills, Savannah, Cordova (Memphis), Scottsdale and now in Morrow (north of Cincinnati, south of Columbus - don't blink you will miss it)
Diagnosed on 12/15/1999 at age 36 while first and only child was four months old. Apparently the cancer grew as my belly was growing. Double mastectomy done on 12/30/1999. Not the best way to welcome in the new year but thanks to the morphine drip I welcomed in the New year starting in New Zealand and ending with the US. No positive nodes but was stage IIB. Did 6 months of CMF. Did tamoxifin for 6 months and was put on arimidex for sanity's sake. Had ovaries removed in October of 2001 and reconstruction in October of 2000.
